Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, I need to understand the raw data. Each line has a timestamp, action type, app, window, and other details. The challenge is to group these into cases, which are logical units of work. The examples given are editing a document, handling an email, or reviewing a PDF.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Looking at the log, the user starts with Microsoft Word, switches to Google Chrome for an email, then to Adobe Acrobat, and back to Excel and Word again. Each switch might indicate a new case or a continuation. But how to group them?

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case identification: The user might be working on multiple tasks. For instance, the first part is working on Document1.docx in Word, then an email in Chrome, then a PDF in Acrobat, then Excel, and back to Word. Each of these could be separate cases if they are distinct tasks. But maybe some are part of the same workflow.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: For example, the email might be related to the document they were working on. But the log shows they opened an email, replied, then went to a PDF. Maybe the email is a separate case. Similarly, the Excel part is another task.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Activity naming: The raw actions like FOCUS, TYPING, SAVE need to be translated into higher-level activities. For example, TYPING in Word could be Drafting Document or Editing Content. SAVE could be Save Document.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Case IDs: Need to assign unique IDs. Maybe based on the document or task. For instance, Document1.docx could be Case 1, the email Case 2, the PDF Case 3, Excel Case 4, and the final Word document Case 5. But need to check if some are part of the same case.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So perhaps each distinct document or task is a case. For example: Case 1: Editing Document1.docx (Word) Case 2: Handling email (Chrome) Case 3: Reviewing Report_Draft.pdf (Acrobat) Case 4: Updating Budget_2024.xlsx (Excel) Case 5: Editing Quarterly_Report.docx (Word)

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: So event 19 would be part of Case 1. Then, event 20: TYPING in Word, Document1.docx Case 1, Activity: Editing Content Event 21: SAVE Case 1, Save Document Event 22: CLOSE Case 1, Close Application

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Now, activity names need to be consistent. For example, Editing Content for TYPING in Word, Composing Email for TYPING in Chrome, Updating Budget Data for TYPING in Excel, Highlighting Key Findings for HIGHLIGHT in Acrobat.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: So the cases would be: Case 1: Document1.docx (Word) Case 2: Email (Chrome) Case 3: Report_Draft.pdf (Acrobat) Case 4: Budget_2024.xlsx (Excel) Case 5: Quarterly_Report.docx (Word) Now, the event log table would have these entries with the respective case IDs and activity names.
